alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 3:42AM PST until February 25 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 10 inches, locally higher, between 1000 to 1500 feet, and 1 to 3 feet between 1500 and 3000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills of the Sacramento Valley and the Motherlode. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Downed trees and tree limbs and local power outages are possible due to heavy snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 1000-2000, locally lower. Heaviest snow expected Thursday afternoon through Friday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
